comment_body: I re-read my code, and like I suggest, I need to replace this by a `delete opts.repeat.immediately;` after the getNextMillis call.
I am not sure about this. Why do we need to delete it?

Because it will be re-used by the next job and that's not what I want. When the first job have been completed `nextJobFromJobData` is called but we need to plan the next job to the next interval not immediately.
ok, but we should not mutate properties from the input object, that can potentially create side effects on the callers code
OK so my first solution was better ? If we don't want to mutate so we need to add a separate flag on the prototype of `nextRepeatableJob` and all over the code ?
I do not remember the previous solution :/.
Just the one with saving immediately flag in the job object, before my refactor commit.
this fix seems to have been slipped in from an unrelated issue.
Must have been from copy-paste, you are right no need for re-assigned the variable, could `pool.release(_child);` directly
Updated PR, removed the unnecessary reassignment
I am thinking that it would be better to change the name to a more explanatory: ```setReuseProcesses``` or similar.
Since we are setting a default value ```true``` a few lines above, this is not necessary.
I do not think we need a setter for this setting, as with the other settings.
renamed the methods and variables in the latest PR
